title: HTML, JS, CSS and nothing else
subtitle: A talk by
sobre-conteudo: Having less code, fewer dependencies and more performance is always utopic for front-end web developers. "HTML, JS, CSS and nothing else" is a talk that advocates for optimized web applications and legible code, dispensing Javascript utilities (like jQuery, lodash and mootools) and often frameworks. The proposal is to end the talk with a web application with code and elegant UI using only native Javascript and CSS3.
